com.matmorcat

Class Segment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.matmorcat.Segment

  • public final class Segment
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an object class that defines the structure of a TCP segment and provides necessary methods to encapsulate fields of the segment and check it for validity. This object also inherits the pseudo-header which is used by the Network Layer to assemble the datagram, but is included in the Transport Layer in order to calculate the checksum. The program is based on the internet standard proposed in RFC 793 - "Transmission Control Protocol" The document can be viewed here for reference: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc793
    Author:
    Matthew Moretz (mcmoretz@uncg.edu)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Segment

        public Segment(java.lang.String sourcePort,
               java.lang.String destPort,
               java.lang.String sequence,
               java.lang.String ack,
               java.lang.String headerLength,
               java.lang.String reserved,
               java.lang.String flags,
               java.lang.String window,
               java.lang.String checksum,
               java.lang.String urgentPointer,
               java.lang.String options,
               java.lang.String payload)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Takes in the contents of a segment and assembles an object from the data. Each bit of information is checked for validity. Hexadecimal and binary are accepted inputs, so long as they adhere to the TCP/IP specifications. An error message will be thrown describing what input is invalid if an invalid input is detected.
        Parameters:
        sourcePort - the port bound to the sending application
        destPort - the port of the receiving application
        sequence - the sequence number of the sender
        ack - the acknowledgement number of the receiver's sequence number
        headerLength - the length of the TCP header (32-bit words)
        reserved - reserved for future use and must be all 0s
        flags - the control flags for transmission
        window - the window size that sender is willing to receive back (octets)
        checksum - the checksum of the pseudo-header + TCP header + payload concatenated
        urgentPointer - the location of any urgent data from the application starting at the first byte of data (octets)
        options - the options (if any) to include, such as security clearance
        payload - the data that is to be transmitted in the segment
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the segment could not be created, because one or more inputs were invalid

      • Segment

        public Segment(java.lang.String data)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Takes in the contents of a segment and assembles an object from the data. Each bit of information is checked for validity. Hexadecimal and binary are accepted inputs, so long as they adhere to the TCP/IP specifications. An error message will be thrown describing what input is invalid if an invalid input is detected.
        Parameters:
        data - the data that is to be transmitted in the segment
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the segment could not be created, because one or more inputs were invalid

      • getHeaderField

        public java.lang.String getHeaderField()
        Get the entire contents of the header in a string of binary. This method combines all of the header fields into a single string of bits.
        Returns:
        the derived entire contents of the header in bits

                         throws java.lang.Exception

      • segmentHasValidChecksum

        public boolean segmentHasValidChecksum()
        Recomputes the header checksum then checks if the header has been corrupted. If the header is corrupted, recalculating the checksum with the entire header will yield one or more binary numbers that are not 0. Result must be 16 bits of 0s to reasonably ensure that the segment header is not corrupted.
        Returns:
        false if the header is corrupted

      • getHeaderLengthInBits

        public int getHeaderLengthInBits()
        Get the expected length of the header in decimal. This method multiplies the header length field (32 bit octets) in decimal form by 32.
        Returns:
        the number of bits that contain the header

      • getOptionsLengthInBits

        public final int getOptionsLengthInBits()
        Get the expected length of the options field in decimal. This method finds the difference between the header length and previous required header fields (always 160 bits or 5 * 32 bit words).
        Returns:
        the number of bits that contain the options

      • getPayloadLengthInBits

        public final int getPayloadLengthInBits()
        Get the expected length of the payload field in decimal. This method finds the difference between the total length and the header length.
        Returns:
        the number of bits that contain the payload

      • getTotalLengthInBits

        public final int getTotalLengthInBits()
        Get the expected length of the segment in decimal. This method multiplies the total length field (in octets) in decimal form by 8 (octet).
        Returns:
        the number of bits that contain the header and data

      • toBinaryIfHex

        public static java.lang.String toBinaryIfHex(java.lang.String data)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Takes in a hexadecimal or binary input and outputs binary. This is used to avoid multiple pattern matches to check if it is binary. If the input is binary, the output will not be changed.
        Parameters:
        data - the data in binary or hex
        Returns:
        the data in binary
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the data could not be recognized as binary or hex

      • padLeftToLength

        public static java.lang.String padLeftToLength(java.lang.String data,
                                               int mod)
        Pad the string with zeros to the left up to a requested multiple of modulus. Can be used for binary and hexadecimal strings that need to fill a field with a fixed length (modulus = length) or for dynamic fields that require any size of a certain modulus.
        Parameters:
        data - the data as a string to pad with 0s
        mod - the modulus to pad to
        Returns:
        the data padded with 0s on the left

      • padRightToLength

        public static java.lang.String padRightToLength(java.lang.String data,
                                                int mod)
        Pad the string with zeros to the right up to a requested multiple of modulus. Can be used for binary and hexadecimal strings that need to fill a field with a fixed length (modulus = length) or for dynamic fields that require any size of a certain modulus.
        Parameters:
        data - the data as a string to pad with 0s
        mod - the modulus to pad to
        Returns:
        the data padded with 0s on the right
